name: Orange Lily
climate: Orange lilies thrive in temperate climates where temperatures are moderate.
They are well-suited to areas with distinct seasonal changes.
In warmer climates, they may require some protection from extreme heat.
These plants can tolerate a range of climates but prefer milder conditions.
sunlight: Orange lilies require full sunlight for most of the day to bloom well.
They can tolerate partial shade, but flowering may be reduced.
Ideally, these plants need at least six hours of direct sunlight daily.
In very hot climates, some afternoon shade can benefit orange lilies.
watering: Orange lilies prefer consistent watering with soil kept moderately moist.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so ensure good drainage.
During dry spells, extra watering may be necessary to maintain moisture.
Reduce watering in the winter when the plant is dormant to prevent rot.
soil: Well-draining soil is crucial for orange lilies to prevent waterlogging.
They thrive in soil that is rich in organic matter, enhancing growth.
A slightly acidic to neutral soil pH is ideal for these lilies.
Improve heavy clay soils by adding sand or compost to increase drainage.
toxic: Orange lilies are toxic to cats and can cause kidney failure if ingested.
extra_care_tip: Deadhead spent flowers to encourage further blooming and a tidy appearance.
